results.title: Folk song fantasy
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Animated puppets and paper cut-outs enact the narratives contained in three folk songs sung by Emma Caslor: “THE RIDDLE SONG”, “WHO KILLED COCK ROBIN ?”, and “THE COOPER OF FIFE”. Animation by Alma Duncan; photography by Lyle Enright.

results.title: Folk dancing is fun
results.creator_credit: Evelyn McCloughan, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Illustrates the important part folk dancing can play in primary education. Shows the teaching of folk dancing in simple movements to young children, and a series of more complicated Latvian and French dances suitable for older children. Demonstrates how actual dancing can lead to activities such as class projects on national folk dances, costumes and music, and how this interest can lead to international understanding and correct social behaviour at an early stage. The film concludes with a school folk dancing festival complete with national costumes made by the children. Music by Barbara Mettam.

results.title: Folk dances today
results.creator_credit: Mario Casetto and F A Film Associates
results.brief_description: At a teenagers’ dance party it is the “in” thing to do Greek and Armenian line dances, the Swedish “hambo”, middle eastern “debkas”, and Bulgarian “kolos”. The film cuts away to show each ethnic dance, or type, performed by exhibition groups with authentic styling in national costumes.

results.title: Folk dances
results.brief_description: An attractively set series of folk-dances, performed by dancers in authentic costumes, dancing to local folk-tunes. The dances include: the Moldavanetz, a Moldavian dance; the Krezhachek, a dance of Belo-Russia; and the Kazaki, a dance of Azerbijzhan. Music only.

results.title: Folk art: the Diana Brandt way
results.brief_description: Nationally renowned folk artist Diana Brandt brings her expertise, handy hints and experience to help you create traditional Bavarian Folk Art for your home. The equipment needed to complete two projects is shown and explained. The three strokes that comprise folk art are demonstrated clearly, simply and step-by-step so that you may practice to perfection at your own pace in your home. Includes scores of hints and shortcuts. Project One is a beautiful oval storage box with a delightfully rustic antique flower arrangement painted on the cover. Project Two is a teapot stand with a simple baroque design.

results.title: Folk art
results.brief_description: Shows a variety of home crafts. A wood carver creating complex scenes and individual figures; women painting the walls of their homes with brightly colored floral designs; a potter making and decorating attractive pieces of pottery; expert needle women designing and working intricate pieces of embroidery.

results.title: Folioscopes
results.brief_description: They’re called folioscopes in France and translate to ‘thumb cinema’ in German, but they’re best known as flipbooks. Popular since the 1860s, flipbooks have been used as promotional tools, cereal box prizes and artworks.

constellations_primary.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_primary.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

results.description: They’re called folioscopes in France and translate to ‘thumb cinema’ in German, but they’re best known as flipbooks. Images come to life when you rapidly flip through pages of sequential illustrations or photographs. Popular since the 1860s, flipbooks have been used as promotional tools, cereal box prizes and artworks. They have animated everything from boxing matches and erotic dances to political propaganda and cartoons.
description_for_label: They’re called folioscopes in France and translate to ‘thumb cinema’ in German, but they’re best known as flipbooks. constellations_primary.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_primary.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

results.title: Foghorn Leghorn: classic Looney Tunes cartoons
results.brief_description: This video collection presents nine of the best of that wisecracking rooster, Foghorn Leghorn. For decades now his practical jokes and witty remarks have captivated audiences of all ages and it is his unique way of talking that makes Foghorn Leghorn stand out from the rest of the crowd. But where would Foghorn Leghorn be without his “companions” Henery Hawk and Barnyard Dog, both of who feature in this collection of cartoons. Suitable entertainment for all the family.
